isis.stitle: ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM: BENDIX - 3000 - AR - 1 ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE - REMOVE AND INSTALL AR - 1 ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE

svcproc.title: REMOVE AND INSTALL AR - 1 ANTILOCK RELAY VALVE

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface and block the wheels and/or hold the vehicle by means other than the air brakes.
Drain the air pressure from all vehicle reservoirs.
Identify, mark or label all air lines and wiring cables and their respective connections on the CR - 15 Relay Valve/EC - 15 Controller to facilitate ease of installation.

note.para: Always turn key switch OFF before disconnecting any portion of the antilock wiring system. If circuits are disconnected with the key ON, the EC - 15 controller will record the open circuit as a fault condition.

step1.para: Disconnect all air lines and wiring.

Note and mark the mounting position of the relay valve/controller assembly on the vehicle. Remove and save the relay valve/controller mounting hardware, then remove the CR - 15 Relay Valve/ECU Controller assembly from the vehicle.
Completely clean the case of the relay valve/controller assembly, making sure to protect the open ports and connectors.

Note and mark the position of the EC - 15 controller relative to the AR - 1 relay valve for later reassembly. Remove the 4 capscrews securing the controller to the relay valve. Carefully separate the controller from the relay valve, making sure not to damage the gasket between the 2 components, if possible. Peel the gasket from the EC - 15 or AR - 1 and retain for use if it is not damaged.

note.para: Use a new gasket if the old gasket is damaged or if a new gasket is readily available.
For disassembly of the relay valve, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES.

step1.para: After noting the relationship of the positioning marks made in Step 7 of Removal, above, position the gasket on the EC - 15, then secure the EC - 15 to the AR - 1 antilock relay valve using the 4 capscrews. Torque the capscrews to 50 - 80 Lb. In. (5.6 - 9.0 Nm).
Install all air line fittings and plugs (as marked during removal) making certain thread sealing material does not enter the valve.
Install the assembled CR - 15 Relay Valve/ECU Controller on the vehicle in the position marked during Step 5 of Removal.
Connect all air lines and wiring cables to the valve and controller assembly using the identification made during Valve Removal Step 3, above.
After installing the valve and controller assembly, test all air fittings for excessive leakage and tighten as needed.
